title: Mexican Prawns with Tortilla wrap & Broccoli
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat almonds in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook prawns 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry broccoli and spinach with cajun blend 13 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Prawns for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Tortilla wrap or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Israeli Tofu (firm) with Polenta & Cabbage

Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the polenta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Polenta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

Use Baby potatoes or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Tofu (firm) and Spinach Bake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 190°C.
Toss spinach and onion with half the almonds, salt, pepper and thai green curry paste; spread on a tray.
Season tofu (firm) and place on the tray. Roast for 28 min, turning once.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Tortilla wrap or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Chicken breast and Peppers Grill
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat almonds in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken breast 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry peppers and asparagus with thai green curry paste 27 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Chicken for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Tortilla wrap or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Mushrooms & Spinach Sweet potato with Cod fillet
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 180°C.
Toss mushrooms and spinach with half the tahini, salt, pepper and harissa; spread on a tray.
Season cod fillet and place on the tray. Roast for 24 min, turning once.
Cook sweet potato until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Cod for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Sweet potato or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Broccoli & Spinach Whole-wheat pasta with Cod fillet
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat ghee in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook cod fillet 3–4 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry broccoli and spinach with garam masala 20 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the whole-wheat pasta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Cod for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Whole-wheat pasta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Belgian Tempeh with Pitta & Onion
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Prepare the fresh components on a board.
Mix tempeh with smoked paprika + cumin and a pinch of salt.
Layer with onion, green beans and pitta.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Pitta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Tuna (canned) and Onion Bake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 190°C.
Toss onion and garlic with half the tahini, salt, pepper and ras el hanout; spread on a tray.
Season tuna (canned) and place on the tray. Roast for 32 min, turning once.
